name: Tott
occupation: FRONT OF HOUSE HOST
You were the face of a company. Now you’re a face without a company.
debt: Slugburn Pest Control
Take a very large pack of slug pellets.
oddity_1: WHO WAS YOUR EMPLOYER?
ATabooRestaurant: Takeatortoiseshell.
oddity_2: WHAT MADE YOU MEMORABLE?
On your first day, you attempted a Unique Accent and got stuck with it.

name: Eppay
occupation: REVOLUTIONARY DUELLIST
You are the sword tip of change in Bastion. Sometimes change for its own sake.
debt: Doctor Harold Pang, Archaeologist
Pays double the value for items still dusty from excavation.
oddity_1: WHAT’S YOUR WEAPON OF CHOICE?
Military-Fork (d8, BULKY).
oddity_2: WHAT’S YOUR FLAIR?
Take an Extra-Fancy Hat with a famous backstory.

name: Sofskey.
occupation: FACTORY RETAINER
Your family left you to the factory. Your time in there is done, so you’ve ended up on the street.
debt: Allied Birdwatchers and Snoops
Share ownership of a huge encyclopaedia of birds and other flying creatures, with eye-holes poked out of the back.
oddity_1: WHAT HAVE YOU SPENT YOUR ENTIRE LIFE STARING AT THROUGH MACHINERY?
Coal: Take a shovel.
oddity_2: WHAT DID YOU GET TO PREPARE YOU FOR THIS?
A broken pistol.

name: Kaywither
occupation: FACTORY RETAINER
Your family left you to the factory. Your time in there is done, so you’ve ended up on the street.
debt: Allied Birdwatchers and Snoops
Share ownership of a huge encyclopaedia of birds and other flying creatures, with eye-holes poked out of the back.
oddity_1: WHAT HAVE YOU SPENT YOUR ENTIRE LIFE STARING AT THROUGH MACHINERY?
Boxes: Take an unassembled box big enough to fit you inside.
oddity_2: WHAT DID YOU GET TO PREPARE YOU FOR THIS?
An empty brandy bottle.

name: Quaykee.
occupation: BAILED PRISONER
You just got out. Your sentence continues.
debt: Slab & Ruck Breakout Services
You weren’t bailed as much as busted out. In addition, you’re all wanted criminals.
oddity_1: WHAT DID YOU BRING OUT WITH YOU?
A set of Handcuffs.
oddity_2: WHAT WAS WAITING OUT HERE FOR YOU?
An ornate but Deactivated Pistol.

name: Jorgun.
occupation: GUTTER MINDER
You’re the bottom of the barrel. Bastion’s crust.
debt: Associated Reanimators
You all died and were re-animated. You are fully functional, but carry a chemical odour.
oddity_1: WHAT HAPPENED TO YOU?
Rat given human form in a lab experiment. You can still speak with rats and loosely understand other rodents.
oddity_2: WHAT ARE YOU HIDING UNDER YOUR RAGS?

Berserker Gland - When you take ABILITY LOSS or suffer serious pain you fly into a rage. Your next melee attack is +d10 but you cannot make ranged attacks. Once the attack is out of your system you return to normal.

name: Dabber
occupation: STREET PERFORMER
Adored by few. Loathed by many.
debt: Penelope Ush, Bureaucratic Law Clerk
Truly clearing the debt requires visiting Bureaucratic Offices in four different corners of Bastion.
oddity_1: WHAT WAS YOUR ACT?
Fire Dance: Take a firebomb (d6 DAMAGE each round until extinguished).
oddity_2: WHAT’S YOUR CLAIM TO FAME?
Your performance only really Works When You’re Drunk, so people ply you with drink to try and get you to perform.

name: Lemon.
occupation: PROFESSIONALGAMBLER
You know how to play well. And how to cheat even better.
debt: Rod & Pearl Sanctioned Looters
You can request a blueprint map of any building in Bastion, but it’s likely to be outdated.
inventory: Slug-gun (d6, very short range), pack of gum (cedar).
oddity_1: WHAT’S YOUR GAME?
Bird Darts: Take a set of darts (d4, +d8 against small flying things).
oddity_2: WHAT DID YOU WIN? (THE OTHER PERSON STILL ISN’T HAPPY ABOUT THIS)
Ego-Mirror - A pocket mirror that reflects the most offensive version of whoever is looking in.

name: Leek
occupation: APPRENTICE SWEEP
Your master died. They took your terrible career prospects along with them.
debt: Soddup Burials
The debt is for a parent’s funeral. Whether through blood or not, you’re all siblings to each other.
oddity_1: WHAT DID YOU SWEEP?
Bookshelves: Dust does not bother you.
oddity_2: WHAT DID YOU DREAM ABOUT AS YOU SWEPT?
Being a Highwayman: Take a fake pistol (only fires blanks).

name: Glum.
occupation: AVANT GUARDSMAN
Not all militias are conventional. Yours was quite interesting before it collapsed.
debt: Small Electrics Board
Share ownership of a bag full of tangled wires and blown fuses.
oddity_1: WHAT MADE YOUR UNIT DIFFERENT?
You have a somewhat-trained Attack Bear (7HP, d8 bite).
oddity_2: WHAT ELSE?
You would only Fight Drunk: Take a bottle of brandy and you’re DEPRIVED when sober.

name: Garrun
occupation: VAULT CRACKER
Most vaults are old enough that nobody can agree who owns them. You’re just tidying up forgotten things.
debt: Slumborn Sisterhood
Share £100 in Slum Vouchers, valid only in the worst boroughs.
oddity_1: WHAT GETS YOU IN?
Take a Crowbar (d6).
oddity_2: WHAT DID YOU FIND?
Case of Poisons - One dose each of ingested, injected, and inhaled poisons.

name: Case
occupation: TRAVELLING SHOW-PERSON
Stunts and tricks are your game. You’ve got a final trick up your sleeve if you start to lose the crowd.
debt: Danger-Worker’s Union
For each of you that comes back with a visible injury you reduce the debt by £500.
oddity_1: WHAT’S YOUR ACT?
Gross-Out Body Horror: You do not feel pain.
oddity_2: WHAT’S YOUR SHOWSTOPPER?
Spider Skin - Climb surfaces as if you were a spider.

name: Scram
occupation: UNDERGROUNDWEIRDO
Born and raised in the Underground, below space and time. You’ve always been odd, and have gotten much worse.
debt: Seapress Aquatic Pest Control
Take shared ownership of a Salt-Unsalt-Bomb. Throwing it into a pond-sized body of water turns saltwater fresh or freshwater salted.
oddity_1: WHAT MAKES YOU APPEAR INHUMAN?
Fly Wings (Clumsy flight).
oddity_2: WHAT KEEPS YOU HUMAN?
Your Pet: Take a misshapen dog-thing (2HP, d4 bite).

name: Hopkin
occupation: GUTTER MINDER
You’re the bottom of the barrel. Bastion’s crust.
debt: Associated Reanimators
You all died and were re-animated. You are fully functional, but carry a chemical odour.
oddity_1: WHAT HAPPENED TO YOU?
Former High Society Member, only survivor after a mob uprising.
oddity_2: WHAT ARE YOU HIDING UNDER YOUR RAGS?

ghter Brand - A three-pointed mark on your hand. When you kill a worthy opponent, one point 5HP turns darker. When all three points turn dark, your arm grows into an unnaturally strong, chitinous claw (d10 DAMAGE) for the next hour. When your arm returns, the brand resets.

name: Scraph/scon
occupation: INSEPARABLE TWINS
There are two of you, identical in most ways. SPECIAL: Divide ABILITY SCORES and HP equally, remainders to the eldest.
debt: Helping Gland Organ Surrogates
Take shared ownership of a heart in a box. It’s well preserved if it is kept sealed.
oddity_1: WHAT DOES THE ELDER TWIN GET?
A Shield (BULKY, +1 ARMOUR) with the family crest.
oddity_2: WHAT DOES THE YOUNGER TWIN GET? (USE YOUR ORIGINAL HP ROLL TO CONSULT THIS TABLE)
A Missing Ear.

name: Jobbinson.
occupation: TUK-TUKKER
Written by Patrick Stuart. "I'm not going over the water at this time of night.”
debt: The Medicine Boat
Take shared ownership of a large bag of fake pills in various marked bottles. They’re all just sugar.
inventory: Broken snooker cue (d6), city map (outdated), tuk-tuk, driving gloves.
oddity_1: WHAT’S UP WITH YOUR TUK-TUK?
Knackered. Can’t turn left.
oddity_2: WHO’VE YOU HAD IN THE BACK, THOUGH?
Harried Ringmaster: Take a top hat, tails, hoop and trained monkey “Bosco” (4HP, d4 bite).

name: Wishaw
occupation: PRIZE BREEDER
You had a small kennel of finely bred animals. Now you’re down to your last pair.
debt: Stamp Appreciation Society
You owe back-dated subscription fees, but share ownership of a worthless postage stamp collection.
inventory: Male and female animal (see below), striking rod (d6), chain and collar of suitable size, cleaning wax.
oddity_1: WHAT DID YOU BREED?
Tiny Goats (2HP, d4 butt, trained to go for the shins).
oddity_2: WHAT HAPPENED TO YOUR BREEDING ENTERPRISE?
Something went wrong with your Radical Breeding Programme. Your mated pair are sterile, but the three of you share a psychic link.

name: Sungeon.
occupation: PRACTISING CHEMIST
A truly modern profession. And you’re almost qualified to do it.
debt: Sweep’s Union
You are strictly forbidden from going onto a rooftop until the debt is paid. They have eyes everywhere.
inventory: Long knife (d6), big flask, test tube.
oddity_1: WHAT’S IN THE BIG FLASK?
Metal-Eating-Acid - Has no effect on any other material.
oddity_2: WHAT’S IN THE TEST TUBE?
Truth Serum - One dose. For the next minute the subject cannot knowingly lie, but is under no obligation to speak the truth.

name: Filou
occupation: PIE-SMUGGLER
Recent studies claim 68% of smuggled goods have been pastry-encased. Business was good, but word has spread too far.
debt: Council for Disbanded Councils
You all have matching badges and wigs for a disbanded council.
oddity_1: WHAT’S IN YOUR PIE?
Tiny Bomb (d8 BLAST) and kidney.
oddity_2: WHAT WAS YOUR LAST BONUS FOR SMUGGLING?
An elaborate Smoking Pipe.

name: Laurel
occupation: ALTERNATIVE GROOMER
You make things pretty and nice-smelling. But not people.
debt: Zonar Municipal Acoustics
You each get an experimental electronic musical instrument, temperamental enough to be worthless.
oddity_1: WHAT WAS YOUR SPECIALITY?
Pet Lizards: Take a scale-scraper (d6).
oddity_2: WHAT WENT WRONG?
You Slipped and Murdered a Client: Take a £1k bounty on your head.

name: Fera.
occupation: TACTILIATOR/TACTILIATRIX

debt: Queen Velveteen
Underworld crime boss and textile tycoon. Has teams of lawyers in burgundy vests and velvet pocket-watches, as well as velvet-masked goon squads.
oddity_1: WHAT WAS YOUR SPECIALITY?

Haptosynesthesian, a Touch-Addict: You carry a texture book, where each page is a different material. By stroking different pages, you can induce any natural sensation or mood, including sleep and short-term amnesia. Affects only you.
oddity_2: WHAT’S THE GREATEST THING YOU'VE EVER TOUCHED?
The Caustic Beasts that Slip and Gibber beneath the Charnel Towers of Oomis: Your left arm is immune to fire and acid, but the rest of you is not.

name: Debbum
occupation: RETAIL THERAPIST
You helped people spend money you had no hope of ever earning. None of it rubbed off onto you.
debt: Finbrake Re-burglary
They accept reclaimed stolen goods for twice their value.
inventory: Self-defence shock-prod (d6, on a roll of 1 it requires recharging).
oddity_1: WHAT WAS YOUR SPECIALITY?
Clothes: You’re always exquisitely dressed.
oddity_2: WHO WAS YOUR BEST CLIENT?
A Wild Ocean Treasure Hunter: Take a returning knife (d6, flies back into your hand with a whistle).

name: Proutnay
occupation: UNDERGROUNDWEIRDO
Born and raised in the Underground, below space and time. You’ve always been odd, and have gotten much worse.

Stubby Horns (+d6 when you charge).
oddity_2: WHAT KEEPS YOU HUMAN?

name: Maker
occupation: PAID FIGHTER

debt: Competitive Floristry Board

Bear Fighting: Take a bristle suit (anyone trying to maul or grapple you takes d6 DAMAGE).
oddity_2: WHAT GOT YOU OUT OF THE GAME?
You Snuck Away: Take a hooded cloak.

name: Jeckeride.
occupation: MASSIFIST OF MASSIFCOUNTRY

debt: Doggarly Artful Latturs
Share ownership of a set of foot-tall capital letters. There are plenty of each letter but no Es or Ns.
inventory: Huge fists (d6 each when unarmed), huge body (swap your highest ABILITY SCORE into STR).
oddity_1: WHAT BIG THING DO YOU HAVE?
Big Hammer (d8, BULKY).
oddity_2: HOW HAVE YOU FITTED IN TO LIFE AMONGST THE SMALL?
Food and Medicine Tester: Ignore the effect of any toxins or poisons.

name: Parrock.
occupation: HUMAN FLOTSAM
You weren’t entirely raised by amphibians. But you’re always slightly damp.
debt: Civic Society of Polishers & Buffers
Mirrored or reflective objects pay off this debt at double the going rate.
oddity_1: WHERE WERE YOU BORN?
In a Ritual Birthing Pool: You’re effectively cold-blooded.
oddity_2: WHAT STUCK WITH YOU?
That Lovely Wet Feeling. You’re DEPRIVED if you ever have to go a day without a soak.

name: Kellar
occupation: BAILED PRISONER
You just got out. Your sentence continues.
debt: Slab & Ruck Breakout Services
You weren’t bailed as much as busted out. In addition, you’re all wanted criminals.
oddity_1: WHAT DID YOU BRING OUT WITH YOU?
Juicy Information from a snitch.
oddity_2: WHAT WAS WAITING OUT HERE FOR YOU?
Your Prosthetic Hand (hook, d6).

name: Lombina
occupation: MASKED HORRORIST
Horrors rise from the Underground. We must make a friend of fear, and scare them back down

You can never remember the name or face of somebody in this Union, or what they really do, but you can always find a member when you need one.

The Iron Snake: If you eat a living thing whole you learn all that it has seen.
oddity_2: WHAT ABOUT WHEN YOU TAKE THE MASK OFF?
You’re mute when not wearing the mask.

occupation: AGRICULTURAL SABOTEUR

debt: Fantus Exotic Hatchery
Take shared ownership of a football-sized Alien-bird egg (unfertilised).

oddity_2: WHAT’S THE LAST SCRAP OF YOUR LIFE AS A SABOTEUR?

You Appear Much Older Than You Are: Take incongruously fashionable clothes.

Faux-Reiner of Trave: Take a box of fancy cigars and bottle of brandy.

oddity_1: WHERE DID YOU GO?
The Mountains: Take a jar of mountain air (smells great).
oddity_2: WHAT HELPED YOU SURVIVE?

It’s a map of Angelic Hierarchies. Hunted by occultists and fools.
oddity_2: HOW DEEP IN THE MUCK DID THE STEAL GET YOU?
You left an Elaborate Series of Clues which only another classically-trained scholar could decipher!

All public gardens in Bastion are dangerous ground, until you answer for your crimes against topiary.
inventory: Set of steel needles, massage ointment, 20-metre-long scroll of esoteric diagrams.

Devices used in Games: Take a bag of dice.
oddity_2: AFTER 30 MINUTES SPENT TREATING THE OBJECT, YOU CAN CAUSE IT TO...

The Bleached Bones of a Nameless Behemoth;Affixed atop theTower Impenetrable: If you touch a limb, you can break the bone beneath. You can break necks the same way.

Martial Fan (d6, also works as a fan).

oddity_2: WHAT’S THE LAST SCRAP OF YOUR LIFE AS A SABOTEUR?
A Sack of Machine-Scrap (1-in-6 chance of any machine part you need being in there).

name: Bater
occupation: ALPHATESTER
Concept by Eric Dalehite. For safety, you had to push the button, flip the switch, taste the glue. Your contract was the only thing worse than your pay.
debt: Motherlode Corporate Incubator

A business conglomerate that delegates all decisions to a workgroup of toddlers. Take shared ownership of an “Expadison Savival Kit” containing sugar-biscuits, a plastic screwdriver, a rubber giraffe, and a flask of sweetened milk.
inventory: Telescopic rod (d6), protective suit (Armour 2 against explosions and fire only, BULKY).
oddity_1: WHAT WAS THE WORST THING TO HAPPEN TO YOU?
Lost a Leg riding an electric staircase. Take a low-quality prosthetic.
oddity_2: WHICH UNSAFE DEVICE DID YOU MANAGE TO KEEP?

Essence Projector - Project and inhabit a ghost version of yourself up to ten feet away. The ghost form is immaterial, can pass through walls, but any contact with fire or electricity deals d12 DAMAGE to your real body.

name: Nelbreen
occupation: AMATEUR DRAMATIST
The whole world is a stage. But you’re not good enough to get paid.
debt: Porkee Sheddam, Owner of Paradiso Park Bastion
Take shared ownership of a very compliant show-pig (3HP).
oddity_1: WHAT WAS YOUR SPECIALITY?
Booming Presence: Your voice carries extremely far.
oddity_2: WHAT PROP DO YOU STILL HAVE?
A Fake Blood Pack.

name: Fossdike
occupation: CANAL NOMAD
Bastion’s waterways are no joke. Something about rails and roads just seems wrong to you.
debt: Great Xtenza
A hook-handed, red-masked maniac who can age or vivify objects with a touch. As former followers, you all get a red mask.
oddity_1: WHAT’S THE MOST USEFUL TOOL FOR CANAL LIFE?
Water Whistle (if blown underwater, this repels any marine life).
oddity_2: WHAT BROUGHT YOU BACK ASHORE?
Your Boat Burned Down: The insurance wouldn’t pay out. Take a Firebomb (d6 DAMAGE each round until extinguished).

name: Pattie
occupation: UNDERGROUNDWEIRDO
Born and raised in the Underground, below space and time. You’ve always been odd, and have gotten much worse.
debt: Seapress Aquatic Pest Control
Take shared ownership of a Salt-Unsalt-Bomb. Throwing it into a pond-sized body of water turns saltwater fresh or freshwater salted.
oddity_1: WHAT MAKES YOU APPEAR INHUMAN?
Fly Wings (Clumsy flight).
oddity_2: WHAT KEEPS YOU HUMAN?
Your Love of the Theatre: Take a costume that helps you pass for a normal person.

name: Hebdon
occupation: GOOD DOG
Smarter than many people. Still a dog.
debt: Maximo Frost
Share ownership of a full set of gramophone recordings by this unpopular musical poet.
oddity_1: WHAT HAPPENED TO YOUR MASTER?
Died of Old Age: You are DEPRIVED while in a hospital or nursing home.
oddity_2: WHAT’S YOUR BEST TRICK?
You’re an Alpha Dog: Other dogs get out of your way, though other alphas can attempt a CHA SAVE to resist your glare.

name: Clancy
occupation: COUNTERFEIT TAXIDERMIST
Fantastic specimens bought you a small amount of money. Now that’s gone, and your name is ruined.
debt: Council for Tarts and Flans
You are blacklisted from all non-bakery food establishments in Bastion until the debt is cleared.
inventory: Scissors, bag of stuffing, book of made-up beasts.
oddity_1: WHAT TYPE OF ANIMAL DO YOU KNOW EVERYTHING ABOUT?
Fish: Take a stuffed walking-trout.
oddity_2: HOW DID YOU GET FOUND OUT AS A FRAUD?
Debunked by a Deceased Rival: Take a pouch of poison dust.

name: Geanne.
occupation: REVOLUTIONARY DUELLIST
You are the sword tip of change in Bastion. Sometimes change for its own sake.
debt: Doctor Harold Pang, Archaeologist
Pays double the value for items still dusty from excavation.
oddity_1: WHAT’S YOUR WEAPON OF CHOICE?
Crow-Sword (d6, doubles as crowbar).
oddity_2: WHAT’S YOUR FLAIR?
Take a pocket of Blinding Powder (DEX SAVE or blinded for one turn. After use, you must visit your supplier for a free refill).

name: Forth
occupation: SKY TROOPER
Your training was so intense that the academy closed after graduation. Now there is no mission, but you still have your gear.
debt: Titan Chimney Stacks
Take shared ownership of an extremely long chimney brush.
inventory: Cutlass (d6), glider-wings (decent for gliding, unsuitable for flight), uniform.
oddity_1: HOW COOL IS YOUR UNIFORM?
It has an Ultra-Fancy Belt Buckle.
oddity_2: WHAT’S IN YOUR HIDDEN POUCH?
A Pen that can fire a single shot (d6).

name: Callas
occupation: ESTATE SQUIRE
Remnants of aristocracy linger between Bastion and Deep Country. History’s long shadow, and you were born into their service.
debt: The Voice of the Hogs
If you consume a pig product or harm any pig-like being, the Voice of the Hogs knows and adds £500 to your debt.
oddity_1: WHY WERE YOU SENT TO BASTION?
To Bring Down the City (you probably won’t): Take a barrow-bomb (d12 BLAST, must be set in place and has a very long fuse, comes with built-in barrow).
oddity_2: WHAT’S WEIRD ABOUT YOUR MASTER?
Their Lands were Flooded: Take a back-raft (BULKY, carries one person, can be carried as a backpack).

name: Nelbreen
occupation: AMATEUR DRAMATIST
The whole world is a stage. But you’re not good enough to get paid.
debt: Porkee Sheddam, Owner of Paradiso Park Bastion
Take shared ownership of a very compliant show-pig (3HP).
oddity_1: WHAT WAS YOUR SPECIALITY?
Crocodile Tears: You can cry on command.
oddity_2: WHAT PROP DO YOU STILL HAVE?
A convincing Fake Snake.

name: Cutver
occupation: UNDER-LABOURER
Construction work on the Underground continues. Despite its lack of regard for time and space.
debt: Camwick & Bodeyman Herbal Remedies
Each take a pack of all-purpose herbal tablets.
oddity_1: WHAT DO YOU KNOW ABOUT THE UNDERGROUND?
The Secret of Time: When underground, you can look around and see roughly what’s changed in the last hour.
oddity_2: WHY DON’T YOU LIKE THE SURFACE?
You can only Speak Gibberish, but understand everyone else just fine.

name: Mucka/macka
occupation: INSEPARABLE TWINS
There are two of you, identical in most ways. SPECIAL: Divide ABILITY SCORES and HP equally, remainders to the eldest.
debt: Helping Gland Organ Surrogates
Take shared ownership of a heart in a box. It’s well preserved if it is kept sealed.
oddity_1: WHAT DOES THE ELDER TWIN GET?
All of the Athletic Prowess. Gain 7 STR.
oddity_2: WHAT DOES THE YOUNGER TWIN GET? (USE YOUR ORIGINAL HP ROLL TO CONSULT THIS TABLE)
A Messed-Up Face.

name: Mimsy
occupation: EXOTIC FOOD SUPPLIER
Written by Arnold Kemp. When people tire of sundry dishes, you step in with new delicacies.
debt: Corbin Cortez the Zoo Keeper
A fearsome hunter who collected most of the animals that are displayed in his zoo. Assisted by a gorilla butler and a mocking bird.
inventory: Large bucket of the appropriate food, long-handled fork (d6).
oddity_1: WHAT IS THE EXOTIC FOOD THAT YOU PROCURED?
Jellyfish Farmer: Popular among those who have no time for lunch. Gain a jelly serving tube in your sleeve, capable of discreetly serving jellyfish at pistol-range.
oddity_2: WHO DID YOU SELL TO?
The Lords of Aluminium and Lumber: Take a powerful rotary saw (d8, BULKY, can cut metal, but slowly and loudly).

name: Bogey
occupation: STREET JUDGE
Bastion has so many courts, the whole city is effectively legal ground. With questionable credentials, you dealt with street quarrels.
debt: Slerrence Tingeon-Larney
Offers d10 x £100 for any item of sufficient curiosity and won’t budge an inch. If you don’t sell it to him he sends thugs after you.
oddity_1: WHY DO YOU NO LONGER PRACTISE?
Quietly Discharged: For filling up prisons too quickly. Take ceremonial judge armour (ARMOUR 1, BULKY).
oddity_2: WHAT DO YOU ALWAYS HAVE WITH YOU?
Your Loyal Scribe (1HP, STR 5, DEX 7, CHA 7, elderly, does nothing but scribe).

name: Hopkin
occupation: GUTTER MINDER
You’re the bottom of the barrel. Bastion’s crust.
debt: Associated Reanimators
You all died and were re-animated. You are fully functional, but carry a chemical odour.
oddity_1: WHAT HAPPENED TO YOU?
You secretly have a wealthy family, and this lifestyle is your way of getting their attention.
oddity_2: WHAT ARE YOU HIDING UNDER YOUR RAGS?

Dehydrated Beasts – Three rubbery things resembling toy animals. If thrown into water, it expands to a Soggy Monstrosity (15HP, d10 Trample). When killed or there's nothing left to kill, the creature collapses into inert powder.

name: Moorlidge
occupation: LIFE SERVANT
Your masters died. You’re free now.
debt: The Gallows Theatre
In addition to your normal clothes, you all have stage costumes covered in fake blood.
oddity_1: WHAT WAS THE WORST PART OF THE JOB?
Constant Gravedigging: Take a spade (d6, BULKY).
oddity_2: WHAT WAS THE BEST PART OF THE JOB?
Felling Gigantic Trees: Take a two-person saw (BULKY).

name: Dalia.
occupation: SANCTIONED EXECUTIONER
You’ve done your time on firing squads. Now you’re allowed to do a little freelance work.
debt: The Psycho-Pack
You are all mind-tethered together. If you focus really hard you can project one word per minute to your pack.
inventory: Rifle (d8, BULKY), killing licence (one person per day, non-transferable).
oddity_1: HOW DO YOU LIVE WITH YOURSELF?
Reminiscence: Take a locket with a picture of a loved one taken from you.
oddity_2: WHAT WAS YOUR BONUS FOR GOOD SERVICE?
Threatening Stave - Has no function, but glows and vibrates in a way that suggests it could be used for distributing extreme pain.

name: Monnier
occupation: BACKWARD LEGIONNAIRE
The future holds only darkness. BACKWARDS! NEVER FORWARDS!
debt: The Fly Heralds
While you are in debt to them, swarming insects of any type do not bother you.
inventory: Un-modern clothes, firebomb (d6 DAMAGE each round until extinguished).
oddity_1: WHAT OBSOLETE WEAPON DO YOU CLING TO?
3 javelins (d6), you’ve named them all.
oddity_2: WHAT’S THE MOST OBSOLETE THING YOU OWN?
A set of Chain Armour (ARMOUR 1, BULKY).

name: Lombina
occupation: MASKED HORRORIST
Horrors rise from the Underground. We must make a friend of fear, and scare them back down
debt: The Populads
You can never remember the name or face of somebody in this Union, or what they really do, but you can always find a member when you need one.
oddity_1: WHAT’S YOUR MASK?
The Grey Man: All living things understand your speech, but are under no obligation to cooperate.
oddity_2: WHAT ABOUT WHEN YOU TAKE THE MASK OFF?
You had it surgically attached and can never take it off.

name: Feau.
occupation: LOCKHOLDER
Canal locks charge a toll, but nobody’s certain who owns them You held a lock for a while
debt: Severin Sistern’s Underground Cruises
You each have a poor quality imitation naval uniform in addition to your normal clothes.
oddity_1: WHICH LOCK KEEPER’S UNION DID YOU BELONG TO?
The Wind Order: Replace your unused pistol with an unused marksman’s rifle (d8, BULKY) and your uniform is extra-smart.
oddity_2: WHAT WENT WRONG?
Canal Pirates Wiped Out Your Organisation. Take a bloody cutlass (d6).

name: Dusty
occupation: TUK-TUKKER
Written by Patrick Stuart. "I'm not going over the water at this time of night.”
debt: The Medicine Boat
Take shared ownership of a large bag of fake pills in various marked bottles. They’re all just sugar.
inventory: Broken snooker cue (d6), city map (outdated), tuk-tuk, driving gloves.
oddity_1: WHAT’S UP WITH YOUR TUK-TUK?
Someone Threw Up in the Back and you can’t get the smell out.
oddity_2: WHO’VE YOU HAD IN THE BACK, THOUGH?
Super-Agent: Take a briefcase with lock-picks, pistol (d6), passport, garrotte (d6), posh club membership and black book of hot contacts. Can be set to explode (d10 BLAST).

name: Rudolf
occupation: URCHIN PACK
Clinging together is your only hope for survival. SPECIAL: You might be more than one person.
debt: Dreamslop Sweetened Gruel
You are all hooked on sugar. If you go a day without eating something very sweet you are DEPRIVED.
oddity_1: WHAT BINDS YOU TOGETHER?
Literally Conjoined.
oddity_2: HOW MANY OF YOU ARE THERE?
Four of you, each with 1HP, and one is a dog.

name: Semillion
occupation: TACTILIATOR/TACTILIATRIX
Written by Arnold Kemp. The power of touch.
debt: Queen Velveteen
Underworld crime boss and textile tycoon. Has teams of lawyers in burgundy vests and velvet pocket-watches, as well as velvet-masked goon squads.
oddity_1: WHAT WAS YOUR SPECIALITY?

Geotactiliator: You are hired to determine the quality of soils and suitability for construction. You gain a Mock Mouse in a hard hat, which builds mouse-sized buildings at tremendous-but-plausible speeds. Must be paid 12p every week.
oddity_2: WHAT’S THE GREATEST THING YOU'VE EVER TOUCHED?
The Bellies of a Hundred Newborn Baby Dolphins, Lined up from Nose to Tail: You can swim twice as fast as normal. If you are naked and carrying nothing, you can swim as fast as a hawk can fly.

name: Frax
occupation: PAID FIGHTER
You’ve been fighting for money. But not enough to get rich or especially tough.
debt: Competitive Floristry Board
You each take a single flower of your choice to wear.
oddity_1: WHAT TYPE OF FIGHTING EXACTLY?
Bear Fighting: Take a bristle suit (anyone trying to maul or grapple you takes d6 DAMAGE).
oddity_2: WHAT GOT YOU OUT OF THE GAME?
You Shot Your Way Out: Take a Pistol (d6).

name: Leek
occupation: APPRENTICE SWEEP
Your master died. They took your terrible career prospects along with them.
debt: Soddup Burials
The debt is for a parent’s funeral. Whether through blood or not, you’re all siblings to each other.
oddity_1: WHAT DID YOU SWEEP?
Sewers: You can see in the dark perfectly.
oddity_2: WHAT DID YOU DREAM ABOUT AS YOU SWEPT?
Avenging your Master: Take a dose of powdered poison.

name: Bingeen
occupation: LOCKHOLDER
Canal locks charge a toll, but nobody’s certain who owns them You held a lock for a while
debt: Severin Sistern’s Underground Cruises
You each have a poor quality imitation naval uniform in addition to your normal clothes.
oddity_1: WHICH LOCK KEEPER’S UNION DID YOU BELONG TO?
Worm Storm: Take worm tattoos. You can speak a language that worms understand, but they are not bound to obey you.
oddity_2: WHAT WENT WRONG?
You were sent on a supply run, and Came Back To A Ruined Lock. Take a donkey (4HP).

name: Yuri
occupation: TACTILIATOR/TACTILIATRIX
Written by Arnold Kemp. The power of touch.
debt: Queen Velveteen
Underworld crime boss and textile tycoon. Has teams of lawyers in burgundy vests and velvet pocket-watches, as well as velvet-masked goon squads.
oddity_1: WHAT WAS YOUR SPECIALITY?

Erotic Author and Masseuse: While you are mostly seeking to usurp last year's best seller: "607 Breasts That I Have Touched" with something more avant-garde, you also know the Dim Bak Massage which causes certain death after five paces.
oddity_2: WHAT’S THE GREATEST THING YOU'VE EVER TOUCHED?
Shivvergrim, the Former Sharpest Sword in the World: You are missing the tip of your right index finger, but you can cut things with the nub as if with a razor.

name: Dervish
occupation: MUDDLED MIXOLOGIST
Written by Mary Hamilton. One drink is too many, A thousand never enough.
debt: Red Devil Distilleries
You’re technically banned from every pub, bar or drinking establishment owned by one of their many, many subsidiaries, and every drink you have in contravention of the ban adds to your tab.
inventory: Bottle of fancy spirit, bottle of rotgut, an excellent bow tie.
oddity_1: WHAT WAS YOUR BAR KNOWN FOR?
Tiki: Take an entire pineapple and a set of earthenware mugs. You can whittle a fancy animal garnish out of almost any fruit.
oddity_2: WHAT DID YOU MANAGE TO BOTTLE? (TAKE ONE BOTTLE)
Red Fireball: Sweet aniseed liqueur with wild strawberry moonshine. Highly flammable (d6).

name: Rowbeck
occupation: COUNCIL RUNNER
With so many councils, a runner is a position of some power. Now your time is finished.
debt: Mayor Impanzi, Mock Chimp
A very serious local politician. Doesn’t want to acknowledge being a Mock Chimp. For whatever reason, you donated to his campaign.
oddity_1: WHAT’S THE BEST THING YOU LEARNED DURING YOUR TIME AS A RUNNER?
The Quickest Way to the Underground from any point in Bastion.
oddity_2: WHAT DID YOU STEAL?
A very loud Klaxon.

name: Wren
occupation: ROOK TAMER
Written by Emmy Allen. The corvids which flock around Bastion see everything. Luckily, they seem to like you.
debt: Municipal Steeplejacks
You owe fines to the steeplejacks who maintain Bastion’s roofs and spires. They want repayment in slates and tiles.
inventory: Spike-pole (d6, BULKY), 3 pet rooks (1HP, d4 peck , flutters about).
oddity_1: WHAT VISIONS DID THE ROOKS SHOW YOU?
Visions of the Sky: Take a pair of gliding-wings that let you leap from rooftops and land safely.
oddity_2: WHY DO THE ROOKSTRUSTYOU?
You Listen toThem: Take an avian dictionary that lets you translate their cawing.

name: Salvation.
occupation: CURIOSITY COMPILER
An entire life spent looking at dusty things and squinting at books. It’s time to get out there for yourself.
debt: The Loot Office
Until you pay off the debt you have a Loot Bounty on your head, meaning you can be stolen from without any illegality.
inventory: Antique pistol (d6, permanently breaks on a roll of 6), magnifying glass, tweed jacket.
oddity_1: WHAT DO YOU KNOW EVERYTHING ABOUT?
Flowers: Take a ball of ribbon.
oddity_2: WHAT’S YOUR PRIZED ODDITY?

Fiend Collar - Any being wearing this collar begins to take on a monstrous appearance and loses d6 CHA each day. At CHA 0 they lose their identity, claim a new identity in your service, but only follow instructions that cause harm to others.

name: Shelton
occupation: PRIZE BREEDER
You had a small kennel of finely bred animals. Now you’re down to your last pair.
debt: Stamp Appreciation Society
You owe back-dated subscription fees, but share ownership of a worthless postage stamp collection.
inventory: Male and female animal (see below), striking rod (d6), chain and collar of suitable size, cleaning wax.
oddity_1: WHAT DID YOU BREED?
Oil Ferrets (2HP, impossible to keep hold of).
oddity_2: WHAT HAPPENED TO YOUR BREEDING ENTERPRISE?
You just got Wanderlust. Take a zoological atlas.

name: And zephryne.
occupation: NECRO-ENGINEER
Concept by Justin Hamilton. Of all Bastion’s industry, the city produces corpses faster than anything. Production on this scale calls for modern methods.
debt: The Jolity Engine
A sentient, building-sized gambling machine. Whenever you visit it offers a spin of its wheels to halve the debt, or double in the case of a loss. Odds are 52% in favour of the Engine.
oddity_1: HOW DID YOU GET YOUR START IN THE CORPSE DISPOSAL INDUSTRY?
Chasing Scavengers Away: One barely-domesticated hyena (5HP, d6 bite) stuck with you.
oddity_2: WHAT WAS YOUR GREAT PROJECT? (YOU COULDN’T GET FUNDING)
The Star Burial: You feel that the Living Stars are taunting your failure. If left alone under starlight you are DEPRIVED.

name: Wun.
occupation: SKY TROOPER
Your training was so intense that the academy closed after graduation. Now there is no mission, but you still have your gear.
debt: Titan Chimney Stacks
Take shared ownership of an extremely long chimney brush.
inventory: Cutlass (d6), glider-wings (decent for gliding, unsuitable for flight), uniform.
oddity_1: HOW COOL IS YOUR UNIFORM?
It has an Ultra-Fancy Belt Buckle.
oddity_2: WHAT’S IN YOUR HIDDEN POUCH?
A Poison Capsule.

name: Silvid.
occupation: AMATEUR DRAMATIST
The whole world is a stage. But you’re not good enough to get paid.
debt: Porkee Sheddam, Owner of Paradiso Park Bastion
Take shared ownership of a very compliant show-pig (3HP).
oddity_1: WHAT WAS YOUR SPECIALITY?
Booming Presence: Your voice carries extremely far.
oddity_2: WHAT PROP DO YOU STILL HAVE?
A flask of Dry Ice.

name: Fossdike
occupation: CANAL NOMAD
Bastion’s waterways are no joke. Something about rails and roads just seems wrong to you.
debt: Great Xtenza
A hook-handed, red-masked maniac who can age or vivify objects with a touch. As former followers, you all get a red mask.
oddity_1: WHAT’S THE MOST USEFUL TOOL FOR CANAL LIFE?
A Wonder-Towel (whip it to instantly dry).
oddity_2: WHAT BROUGHT YOU BACK ASHORE?
Your Crew Drowned: Take a bottle of rum.

name: Slipper
occupation: ACADEMIC DEBATER
Somebody must argue the positions that nobody cares about. You were that somebody.
debt: Conglomerated Taxes
You are exempt from certain taxes, gaining an effective 50% discount on pets, hair products, and offal.
oddity_1: WHAT CAN YOU DEBATE FOREVER?
Taxation: Choose a favourite tax.
oddity_2: WHAT DID YOUR UNIVERSITY PROVIDE AS A LEAVING GIFT?
A box of Psychedelic Mushrooms (two doses, instant effect).

name: Monnier
occupation: BACKWARD LEGIONNAIRE
The future holds only darkness. BACKWARDS! NEVER FORWARDS!
debt: The Fly Heralds
While you are in debt to them, swarming insects of any type do not bother you.
inventory: Un-modern clothes, firebomb (d6 DAMAGE each round until extinguished).
oddity_1: WHAT OBSOLETE WEAPON DO YOU CLING TO?
A hickory longbow (d6).
oddity_2: WHAT’S THE MOST OBSOLETE THING YOU OWN?
Portable but heavy Sundial.

name: Krayker
occupation: SQUIDBAGGER
70% of Bastion’s products contain cephalopod-derived parts. According to these studies, you keep the city running.
debt: Mister Dick
A colossal mock-shark and loan shark (STR 18, 15HP, ARMOUR 2, d10 jaws). He attacks your ship if you go out to sea without paying your debt.
oddity_1: WHAT ALWAYS ACCOMPANIED YOU TO SEA?
A Sea-Frog (1HP, can croak a simple tune).
oddity_2: WHAT DID YOU ALWAYS WANT TO DO INSTEAD?
You Live for Squidbagging: Replace your hook with a prototype cephalopole (d6, BULKY, +d8 against anything with tentacles).

name: Tubett
occupation: BODY JOCKEY
You have a fantastic body, but it is simply your vehicle. Keep your fragile self hidden.
debt: The Machine Shop
Take shared ownership of a pair of broken typewriters.
inventory: Complete control of a fake body (which has the ABILITY SCORES you rolled). Your true form rides on top.
oddity_1: WHAT’S UP WITH YOUR FAKE BODY?
It’s a Heap of White Slime that happens to take a humanoid form.
oddity_2: WHAT’S YOUR TRUE FORM?
Mock Lobster (2d6 for all ABILITY SCORES, 4HP).

name: Dent.
occupation: AMATEURAMPUTATOR
Not trained in the finesse stuff. Major structural work only.
debt: Deb Worldkiller
You technically owe her money from a cult membership you don’t remember agreeing to.
oddity_1: WHAT UNSETTLED YOUR PATIENTS?
Your Sense of Humour: Take a book of anatomy jokes.
oddity_2: WHAT ELSE DID YOU BRING TO WORK?
Magnifying Lens with adjustable focus.

name: Tott
occupation: FRONT OF HOUSE HOST
You were the face of a company. Now you’re a face without a company.
debt: Slugburn Pest Control
Take a very large pack of slug pellets.
oddity_1: WHO WAS YOUR EMPLOYER?
A Confectionery Factory: Take a bag of sherbet.
oddity_2: WHAT MADE YOU MEMORABLE?
You know a few Street Magic Tricks but nothing truly magical.

name: Jannifer.
occupation: MACHINE WHISPERER
Industrial machinery sometimes needs a mallet, sometimes a whisper. You carry both.
debt: Cracknuggle Marbles and Jacks
Each of you choose to have either a bag of marbles, jacks, or a yo-yo.
inventory: Mallet (d6), set of screwdrivers and spanners.
oddity_1: WHAT GAVE YOU YOUR LOVE OF MACHINES?
You were a Gear-Monkey in a Sweatshop: You’re still double-jointed from squeezing into gaps.
oddity_2: WHAT’S YOUR PARTICULAR APPROACH?
You Know Next-to-Nothing about machines, just more than your employer. It got you paid for a while. Take a particularly shiny tool set.

name: Dent.
occupation: AMATEURAMPUTATOR
Not trained in the finesse stuff. Major structural work only.
debt: Deb Worldkiller
You technically owe her money from a cult membership you don’t remember agreeing to.

Mistrust of Anaesthetic: Swap your ether for a healing-hand symbol.
oddity_2: WHAT ELSE DID YOU BRING TO WORK?
Magnifying Lens with adjustable focus.

name: Tangetta.
occupation: HUMAN UNIONIST
The world is full of strange and powerful things. None of them deserve our worship.
debt: The Masterphagers
You have learned the technique to safely eat anything up to the size of your fist, but only food provides nourishment.
oddity_1: WHAT WAS YOUR DAY JOB?
Private Investigator: Take a pistol (d6).
oddity_2: WHAT MADE YOU JOIN THE UNION?
Your Parents were high ranking members. You have some sway within the Union.

name: Bramiah.
occupation: BACKWARD LEGIONNAIRE
The future holds only darkness. BACKWARDS! NEVER FORWARDS!
debt: The Fly Heralds
While you are in debt to them, swarming insects of any type do not bother you.
inventory: Un-modern clothes, firebomb (d6 DAMAGE each round until extinguished).
oddity_1: WHAT OBSOLETE WEAPON DO YOU CLING TO?
3 javelins (d6), you’ve named them all.
oddity_2: WHAT’S THE MOST OBSOLETE THING YOU OWN?
A set of Chain Armour (ARMOUR 1, BULKY).

name: Horace
occupation: CONSTABLE OF BIRDS AND CREEPING THINGS
Written by Arnold Kemp. Protector of the laws of nature.
debt: The Society of Licensed Birds

A decrepit opera hall, home to many of Bastion's registered avians. Some roost in the opera boxes, while waterbirds nest in the flooded orchestra pit. While all of the office-holders are birds, the actual governing is performed by their human secretaries. They oversee all bird law in Bastion.
inventory: Hammer (d6), net, pamphlet of local laws.
oddity_1: WHAT WAS YOUR SPECIALITY?

Interrogator: Gain a interrogation box, about a metre in each dimension. It has a large acoustic horn flaring from the top. If a person or animal is placed inside it, all speech is translated as it passes into or out of the horn.
oddity_2: WHAT FIELD OF LAW ARE YOU MOST EXPERIENCED IN?
Airway Access: You gain a "No Flying" sign. If hung up on a wall, all forms of flight become impossible within reading distance.

name: Vega
occupation: STAR BLESSED
You don’t just worship the Living Stars. One of them has gifted you.
debt: Baztuon Order of Vaultkeepers
You have shared ownership of a vault-buster bomb (d12, must be set in place).
oddity_1: WHAT WAS YOUR DUTY WITHIN THE STAR-BLESSED UNION?
Sacrificial Executioner: Swap your mace for an executioner bludgeon (d8, BULKY).
oddity_2: WHAT’S YOUR STAR GIFT?
Broken Basilisk Symbol - Two pieces of an eye-like symbol set in lead. Anyone holding the pieces together while looking at it loses d20 CHA.

name: Yulrick
occupation: GANG ENFORCER
Internal threats can tear a gang apart. Enforcers keep things in order.
debt: Specialist Individual’s Grooming Lounge
You are all groomed in a way that looks fantastic today, but looks tired tomorrow unless you return for an appointment (£100 each).
oddity_1: WHO WERE YOUR GANG, BEFORE YOU ABANDONED THEM?
Meat Hive: Take a huge sword (d8, BULKY) and lots of piercings.
oddity_2: WHAT HELPED YOU INSPIRE FEAR IN YOUR VICTIMS?
Proxy Chain - When two or more beings are in contact with the chain, any harmful effects that affect one of them affect all.

name: Sonny.
occupation: MASKED HORRORIST
Horrors rise from the Underground. We must make a friend of fear, and scare them back down
debt: The Populads
You can never remember the name or face of somebody in this Union, or what they really do, but you can always find a member when you need one.
oddity_1: WHAT’S YOUR MASK?
The Red Beast: You have the enhanced scent and hearing of a dog.
oddity_2: WHAT ABOUT WHEN YOU TAKE THE MASK OFF?
You can choose how your face appears each time you take it off.

name: Yuri
occupation: TACTILIATOR/TACTILIATRIX
Written by Arnold Kemp. The power of touch.
debt: Queen Velveteen
Underworld crime boss and textile tycoon. Has teams of lawyers in burgundy vests and velvet pocket-watches, as well as velvet-masked goon squads.
oddity_1: WHAT WAS YOUR SPECIALITY?

Haptosynesthesian, a Touch-Addict: You carry a texture book, where each page is a different material. By stroking different pages, you can induce any natural sensation or mood, including sleep and short-term amnesia. Affects only you.
oddity_2: WHAT’S THE GREATEST THING YOU'VE EVER TOUCHED?
Shivvergrim, the Former Sharpest Sword in the World: You are missing the tip of your right index finger, but you can cut things with the nub as if with a razor.

name: Zastra
occupation: PRACTISING CHEMIST
A truly modern profession. And you’re almost qualified to do it.
debt: Sweep’s Union
You are strictly forbidden from going onto a rooftop until the debt is paid. They have eyes everywhere.
inventory: Long knife (d6), big flask, test tube.
oddity_1: WHAT’S IN THE BIG FLASK?
Endo-Fluid - White slime that extinguishes anything up to a house fire when splashed around.
oddity_2: WHAT’S IN THE TEST TUBE?
Ultimate Solvent - Dissolves any matter it touches. Enough to dissolve a fist-sized amount.

name: Shelina.
occupation: NEWSPAPER INTERN
You were technically paid to write technically-non-lies. It never really got off the ground.
debt: Society for the Punishment of Wayward Students
Your debt is to pay for breakages you caused by some prank in your youth. You know a load of dumb code words that only you understand.
oddity_1: WHAT WAS THE WORST STORY YOU HAD TO COVER?
Collapse of Order at a Zoo: Take a sack of animal feed.
oddity_2: WHAT DID YOU TAKE FROM THE PRESS OFFICE BEFORE YOUR INTERNSHIP ENDED?
Heavy Rod (d6, BULKY) from the printing press.

name: Derrow
occupation: GUTTER MINDER
You’re the bottom of the barrel. Bastion’s crust.
debt: Associated Reanimators
You all died and were re-animated. You are fully functional, but carry a chemical odour.
oddity_1: WHAT HAPPENED TO YOU?
You secretly have a wealthy family, and this lifestyle is your way of getting their attention.
oddity_2: WHAT ARE YOU HIDING UNDER YOUR RAGS?

ghter Brand - A three-pointed mark on your hand. When you kill a worthy opponent, one point 5HP turns darker. When all three points turn dark, your arm grows into an unnaturally strong, chitinous claw (d10 DAMAGE) for the next hour. When your arm returns, the brand resets.

name: Wammel.
occupation: ANIMAL VASSAL
You are property of an Animal Patron, but crave a human life. You know better than to displease your liege.
debt: The Standards Unification Office
You are bound by oath to use an obscure time system rather than more popular standards. None of you can read a normal clock or calendar.
inventory: Dagger (d6, decorated to suit your patron), ridiculous garment marking you as property of an animal.
oddity_1: WHICH ANIMAL PATRON DID YOU SERVE?
A Mummified Platypus: Can communicate telepathically. Mostly desires food that it cannot eat.
oddity_2: WHAT ERRAND HAVE YOU ABANDONED?
Buying Fine Clothes for your Patron: Take a formal suit to fit them.

name: Anno
occupation: DISINHERITED SOCIALITE
Whatever happened between you and your family, you’re off the will. You took what you could.
debt: Troffem Canal Diggers
You have been given a Chaperone Toad to carry around with you, feeding information back to your Debtholders. If the Toad is lost a £1k fee is added onto your Debt.
inventory: Claymore (d8, BULKY), 3 bottles of fancy wine, frilly shirt.
oddity_1: WHAT DO YOU LEGALLY STILL HAVE FROM THE ESTATE?
Loyal Butler: Has nowhere else to go (3HP).
oddity_2: WHAT DID YOU SNEAK OUT OF THE VAULT? (THE FAMILY WANT IT BACK)
Companion Ball - A hollow ball that rolls behind you and never stops trying to follow you. Can pop open to store a head-sized object or smaller, protecting it perfectly.

name: Kraub.
occupation: INTEGRATED ALIEN
You came to Bastion a long time ago, almost passing for human. Under a foreign star, reached by sea or underground.
debt: The Queuing Office
When you go back to pay your debt, the queue takes d4 x d4 hours. Every four hours, add d4 hours. There is a drinks trolley available at all times.
inventory: Weird gun, steel rope, vague accent.
oddity_1: WHAT’S YOUR WEIRD GUN?
Fires Vibro-Wave (d8, no pain, but explosion on death, BULKY).
oddity_2: WHAT’S YOUR BARELY-REMEMBERED HOME?
Nebula - The Light of the Sky. Glow in multicolour at will.

name: Emile
occupation: DISINHERITED SOCIALITE
Whatever happened between you and your family, you’re off the will. You took what you could.
debt: Troffem Canal Diggers
You have been given a Chaperone Toad to carry around with you, feeding information back to your Debtholders. If the Toad is lost a £1k fee is added onto your Debt.
inventory: Claymore (d8, BULKY), 3 bottles of fancy wine, frilly shirt.
oddity_1: WHAT DO YOU LEGALLY STILL HAVE FROM THE ESTATE?
Falcon: Your mother’s favourite (2HP, d6 claws).
oddity_2: WHAT DID YOU SNEAK OUT OF THE VAULT? (THE FAMILY WANT IT BACK)
Curse Doll - Anything that affects the doll also affects you, beneficial or harmful.

name: Hessamora.
occupation: CONSTABLE OF BIRDS AND CREEPING THINGS
Written by Arnold Kemp. Protector of the laws of nature.
debt: The Society of Licensed Birds

A decrepit opera hall, home to many of Bastion's registered avians. Some roost in the opera boxes, while waterbirds nest in the flooded orchestra pit. While all of the office-holders are birds, the actual governing is performed by their human secretaries. They oversee all bird law in Bastion.
inventory: Hammer (d6), net, pamphlet of local laws.
oddity_1: WHAT WAS YOUR SPECIALITY?
Bailiff: You gain a set of manacles. For you, slapping a manacle on a limbed creature is as easy as touching its wrist or ankle.
oddity_2: WHAT FIELD OF LAW ARE YOU MOST EXPERIENCED IN?

Impedance of Legal Traffic: You gain a "Detour" sign. If hung upon a door, portal, or passageway, subtle psychic emanations cause creatures to assume that the passage is nonfunctional (even when that makes very little sense). The effect is ruined if they see visible proof of the passage's functionality.

name: Ongel
occupation: COUNTERFEIT TAXIDERMIST
Fantastic specimens bought you a small amount of money. Now that’s gone, and your name is ruined.
debt: Council for Tarts and Flans
You are blacklisted from all non-bakery food establishments in Bastion until the debt is cleared.
inventory: Scissors, bag of stuffing, book of made-up beasts.
oddity_1: WHAT TYPE OF ANIMAL DO YOU KNOW EVERYTHING ABOUT?
Birds: Take a stuffed gorilla-owl.
oddity_2: HOW DID YOU GET FOUND OUT AS A FRAUD?
Confessed after Losing a Duel: Take a sabre (d6).

name: Carrock
occupation: CRIMINAL BUREAUCRAT
The laws of Bastion are written so every crime has a loophole. People paid you to perform crimes, legally.
debt: The Backward Legion
They accept stolen items of modern technology for twice their value against your debt, but destroy them immediately.
oddity_1: WHAT WAS YOUR SPECIALITY?
Libel: You have contacts in a printing press that will print any lie you want.
oddity_2: WHAT DID YOUR LAST CLIENT PAY YOU IN PLACE OF MONEY?

Blank Contract - A contract with blank parts. Can be modified into any sort of deal you wish. The first party to break the contract is struck by a bolt from above (d12, ignore ARMOUR) and the contract explodes into confetti.

name: Abbie
occupation: DEAD-SHORESMAN
You died, but found a way back from where you went. Nobody believes you, and everyone you once knew is long gone.
debt: King Haffwun of Shambly Hole
You are all branded as property of this Deep Country King.
inventory: Flintpistol (d8, outdated and hard to repair), broken oar (d6), cold blood.
oddity_1: £1 Family Name: A powerful name in Bastion.
The Living Stars: 50% chance to know any language you encounter.
oddity_2: 1HP Amnesia Flask - Anybody doused in the water loses a specific memory as defined by the douser. Anybody drinking the water as it falls absorbs the memories. Refills require a Specialist source.

Tiny Phantasm - A floating mass of swirling colours the size of a penny. It follows your every command and leaves a multicolour trail across any surface it touches. Cannot physically interact in any other way.

name: Flinch
occupation: STREET JUDGE
Bastion has so many courts, the whole city is effectively legal ground. With questionable credentials, you dealt with street quarrels.
debt: Slerrence Tingeon-Larney
Offers d10 x £100 for any item of sufficient curiosity and won’t budge an inch. If you don’t sell it to him he sends thugs after you.
oddity_1: WHY DO YOU NO LONGER PRACTISE?
Mushroom Binge: Take a bag of psychedelic mushrooms.
oddity_2: WHAT DO YOU ALWAYS HAVE WITH YOU?
Smoke Bomb and a sense of showmanship.

name: Lyonelle.
occupation: SCIENCE MYSTIC
The past was nothing but lies. There is hidden truth in these modern ways.
debt: Flex Restaurant
You are blacklisted from every reputable eatery in Bastion until you pay.
inventory: Ceramic staff (d6, BULKY, non-reactive to chemicals), glue, solvent.
oddity_1: WHERE IS THE TRUTH HIDDEN?
In Patterns of Corrosion: Take two flasks of acid.
oddity_2: WHAT HAVE YOU FORESEEN?
The Star Men will Come for Us: Take a star symbol.

name: Volter
occupation: MASKED HORRORIST
Horrors rise from the Underground. We must make a friend of fear, and scare them back down
debt: The Populads
You can never remember the name or face of somebody in this Union, or what they really do, but you can always find a member when you need one.
oddity_1: WHAT’S YOUR MASK?
The Blank Mask: You cause no sound and leave no footprints.
oddity_2: WHAT ABOUT WHEN YOU TAKE THE MASK OFF?
Your face is disfigured underneath.

name: Loeb
occupation: SCIENCE MYSTIC
The past was nothing but lies. There is hidden truth in these modern ways.
debt: Flex Restaurant
You are blacklisted from every reputable eatery in Bastion until you pay.
inventory: Ceramic staff (d6, BULKY, non-reactive to chemicals), glue, solvent.
oddity_1: WHERE IS THE TRUTH HIDDEN?
In the Electric Lamps: Take a multi-setting lamp.
oddity_2: WHAT HAVE YOU FORESEEN?
Our Bodies are Destined to be Cast Aside: Take a mechanical hand.

name: Swinburne
occupation: MUDDLED MIXOLOGIST
Written by Mary Hamilton. One drink is too many, A thousand never enough.
debt: Red Devil Distilleries
You’re technically banned from every pub, bar or drinking establishment owned by one of their many, many subsidiaries, and every drink you have in contravention of the ban adds to your tab.
inventory: Bottle of fancy spirit, bottle of rotgut, an excellent bow tie.
oddity_1: WHAT WAS YOUR BAR KNOWN FOR?
Obscure: Take a leather-wrapped assortment of tiny bottles of home-made bitters and shrubs. You can pickle, preserve, or infuse virtually anything, given enough time.
oddity_2: WHAT DID YOU MANAGE TO BOTTLE? (TAKE ONE BOTTLE)
Golden Serpent: Cinnamon liqueur, gold leaf, fresh mint, apple juice, absinthe. Causes powerful hallucinations.

name: Smiff.
occupation: DECONSTRUCTOR
Before the new can arise, the old must come down. Doesn’t mean we can’t enjoy it.
debt: Redway Relief Fund
You share a survival pack containing star-water, a moon crystal, and some sacred dirt. They’re all useless.
oddity_1: WHAT’S YOUR BEST BIT OF SALVAGE?
Time Bomb - Time slows down sixty times in a 10m sphere around the BLAST. Lasts for a minute outside the sphere, or one second inside. One use.
oddity_2: WHY DID YOUR COLLEAGUES MOCK YOU?
You’re secretly a Gifted Dancer.

name: Tut.
occupation: WORTHLESS GRADUATE
You’ve spent a long time in colleges, arguing about words. Your career prospects are poor.
debt: Forssa Hook and Anchor
Share ownership of a small rowboat (with wheels and handles for pushing on land).
oddity_1: WHAT WAS YOUR SUBJECT?
Occult Medicine: You can “order off-menu” when you visit a surgeon.
oddity_2: WHAT WAS YOUR FAVOURITE EXTRA-CURRICULAR ACTIVITY?
Chopping Logs: Take a long axe (d8, BULKY).

name: Brassica
occupation: SMALL TOWN REFUGEE
Your Deep Country home was awful. Finally, the railway came, and you headed to Bastion.
debt: Lucky Mascots Ltd
You have shared ownership of a well-groomed but stupid donkey (1HP). No refunds.
inventory: Whittling knife (d6), outdated clothes, sandwich box.
oddity_1: WHAT WAS SO BAD ABOUT YOUR TOWN?
Yokel Magnet: Bearded warriors riding twisted man-steeds drove your entire town to flee to Bastion. You’ll keep bumping into other yokels from back home and they want to cling to you.
oddity_2: WHAT’S YOUR FAMILY HEIRLOOM?
Pumpkin carved into a very good likeness of a family member.

name: Wren
occupation: ROOK TAMER
Written by Emmy Allen. The corvids which flock around Bastion see everything. Luckily, they seem to like you.
debt: Municipal Steeplejacks
You owe fines to the steeplejacks who maintain Bastion’s roofs and spires. They want repayment in slates and tiles.
inventory: Spike-pole (d6, BULKY), 3 pet rooks (1HP, d4 peck , flutters about).
oddity_1: WHAT VISIONS DID THE ROOKS SHOW YOU?
Visions of the Sky: Take a pair of gliding-wings that let you leap from rooftops and land safely.
oddity_2: WHY DO THE ROOKSTRUSTYOU?
You Resemble Them: Your hands are replaced with clumsy prosthetics which resemble bird-feet.

name: Fera.
occupation: TACTILIATOR/TACTILIATRIX
Written by Arnold Kemp. The power of touch.
debt: Queen Velveteen
Underworld crime boss and textile tycoon. Has teams of lawyers in burgundy vests and velvet pocket-watches, as well as velvet-masked goon squads.
oddity_1: WHAT WAS YOUR SPECIALITY?

Geotactiliator: You are hired to determine the quality of soils and suitability for construction. You gain a Mock Mouse in a hard hat, which builds mouse-sized buildings at tremendous-but-plausible speeds. Must be paid 12p every week.
oddity_2: WHAT’S THE GREATEST THING YOU'VE EVER TOUCHED?
The Bleached Bones of a Nameless Behemoth;Affixed atop theTower Impenetrable: If you touch a limb, you can break the bone beneath. You can break necks the same way.

name: Cator
occupation: MAP THIEF
Written by Patrick Stuart. “Obviously I fully intended to return it.”
debt: Personal Secret Salvage
Take shared ownership of a shuttup-staple (whisper a secret about somebody else into this small box. Anybody that reveals this secret to you loses d12 CHA in agonising head pain. One use only).
inventory: Universal library card, butterfly knife (d6), lock picks, white protective gloves.
oddity_1: WHAT DID THE PREVIOUS OWNERS NOT KNOW ABOUT THE MAP YOU STOLE?
It shows the way to the Living Stars!
oddity_2: HOW DEEP IN THE MUCK DID THE STEAL GET YOU?
There’s a Bounty (£1k) on your head and detectives on your trail!

name: Parthia.
occupation: ASSOCIATED BURGLAR
You burgled only sanctioned properties. You don’t fully understand the legality.
debt: Young Errant’s University for Practical Studies
You share ownership of a set of basic engine repair tools.
oddity_1: WHAT’S YOUR CHOICE OF BURGLARY EQUIPMENT?
Bottle of Ether with long-range spray attachment.
oddity_2: WHICH TYPE OF BUILDING DID YOU TARGET?
Offices: Take a poison pen (d4, d12 DEX Loss on CRITICAL DAMAGE).

name: Erik
occupation: CRITTER CATCHER
Bastion’s gutters and pipes are home to every beast you can imagine. You always wanted to study them all.
debt: Glasshead Psychiatric Tonics
If you all agree to taking an experimental remedy you can remove £2500 from your Debt. The remedy lasts a week, during which time you are physically incapable of lying.
oddity_1: WHAT WAS YOUR SPECIALITY?
Bugs: Take a trained grasshopper (1HP) in a cage.
oddity_2: WHAT ELSE DID YOU BRING?
An Old Halberd (d6, BULKY, blunt).

name: Grunion
occupation: CANAL NOMAD
Bastion’s waterways are no joke. Something about rails and roads just seems wrong to you.
debt: Great Xtenza
A hook-handed, red-masked maniac who can age or vivify objects with a touch. As former followers, you all get a red mask.
oddity_1: WHAT’S THE MOST USEFUL TOOL FOR CANAL LIFE?
A Wonder-Towel (whip it to instantly dry).
oddity_2: WHAT BROUGHT YOU BACK ASHORE?
You Cannot Swim: You finally came to your senses.

name: Hebdon
occupation: GOOD DOG
Smarter than many people. Still a dog.
debt: Maximo Frost
Share ownership of a full set of gramophone recordings by this unpopular musical poet.
oddity_1: WHAT HAPPENED TO YOUR MASTER?
They Got an Even Better Dog: You are DEPRIVED if you’re not wearing your collar.
oddity_2: WHAT’S YOUR BEST TRICK?
You Bond to Another Character: If they are in danger, you ignore CRITICAL DAMAGE, but can die at STR 0 as normal.

occupation: NEWSPAPER INTERN
You were technically paid to write technically-non-lies. It never really got off the ground.

Escaped Swan: Take a net.
oddity_2: WHAT DID YOU TAKE FROM THE PRESS OFFICE BEFORE YOUR INTERNSHIP ENDED?
Paper-Boy that has nowhere else to go (DEX 15, 2HP) and blindly obeys you.

You share a survival pack containing star-water, a moon crystal, and some sacred dirt. They’re all useless.

Sub-Flare - A one-shot pistol that launches a burning flare immediately skywards, burning through any substance in the way and leaving a fist-width hole.
oddity_2: WHY DID YOUR COLLEAGUES MOCK YOU?
Your Annoying Sibling follows you everywhere (2d6 ABILITY SCORES, 1HP, d6 hammer).

name: Rigella
occupation: STAR BLESSED
You don’t just worship the Living Stars. One of them has gifted you.
debt: Baztuon Order of Vaultkeepers
You have shared ownership of a vault-buster bomb (d12, must be set in place).
oddity_1: WHAT WAS YOUR DUTY WITHIN THE STAR-BLESSED UNION?
Sacrificial Executioner: Swap your mace for an executioner bludgeon (d8, BULKY).
oddity_2: WHAT’S YOUR STAR GIFT?
Wild Tongue - You can talk with any living thing, but what they tell you might not make sense.

It’s inside your head. You can’t hold it in any longer.
debt: Under-Kin
Their office is far, far underground and they’re very, very mutated.

Worked in a Distant Mine: Take a pick-axe (d6, BULKY).
oddity_2: WHAT’S YOUR HIDDEN POWER?
You Appear Invisible to one person that you focus on.

name: Grouze
occupation: MASTER BLENDER

Your masters died. You’re free now.

Walking the Grandmaster: Take a cane (d6).
oddity_2: WHAT WAS THE BEST PART OF THE JOB?
Felling Gigantic Trees: Take a two-person saw (BULKY).

name: Eddien
occupation: STREET PERFORMER
Adored by few. Loathed by many.
debt: Penelope Ush, Bureaucratic Law Clerk
Truly clearing the debt requires visiting Bureaucratic Offices in four different corners of Bastion.

Fire Dance: Take a firebomb (d6 DAMAGE each round until extinguished).
oddity_2: WHAT’S YOUR CLAIM TO FAME?
Your performance helped drum up support for a Political Movement. A band of revolutionaries owe you a favour.

Judge: You can pronounce sentences on guilty captives. This only works if the target is (a) helpless and restrained, (b) guilty of a crime, according to one of your definitions, and (c) able to understand you. You name a prohibited action, and the target will henceforth never perform the action willingly.
oddity_2: WHAT FIELD OF LAW ARE YOU MOST EXPERIENCED IN?
Airway Access: You gain a "No Flying" sign. If hung up on a wall, all forms of flight become impossible within reading distance.

name: Foal
occupation: REVOLUTIONARY DUELLIST
You are the sword tip of change in Bastion. Sometimes change for its own sake.
debt: Doctor Harold Pang, Archaeologist
Pays double the value for items still dusty from excavation.
oddity_1: WHAT’S YOUR WEAPON OF CHOICE?
Military-Fork (d8, BULKY).
oddity_2: WHAT’S YOUR FLAIR?
Take a pack of Tiny Smoke Bombs (Make enough smoke for you to quickly dash away. After use, you must visit your supplier for a free refill).

name: Debbum
occupation: RETAIL THERAPIST
You helped people spend money you had no hope of ever earning. None of it rubbed off onto you.
debt: Finbrake Re-burglary
They accept reclaimed stolen goods for twice their value.
inventory: Self-defence shock-prod (d6, on a roll of 1 it requires recharging).
oddity_1: WHAT WAS YOUR SPECIALITY?
Drinks: You can claim a free drink in most bars.
oddity_2: WHO WAS YOUR BEST CLIENT?
A Washed-Up Stage Comedian: Take a water-squirting flower.

name: Churl
occupation: DISINHERITED SOCIALITE
Whatever happened between you and your family, you’re off the will. You took what you could.
debt: Troffem Canal Diggers
You have been given a Chaperone Toad to carry around with you, feeding information back to your Debtholders. If the Toad is lost a £1k fee is added onto your Debt.
inventory: Claymore (d8, BULKY), 3 bottles of fancy wine, frilly shirt.
oddity_1: WHAT DO YOU LEGALLY STILL HAVE FROM THE ESTATE?
Hunting Hound: Past their prime (4HP, d6 bite).
oddity_2: WHAT DID YOU SNEAK OUT OF THE VAULT? (THE FAMILY WANT IT BACK)
Cosmic Ranker - A grey wand that can be asked to judge between two objects. Criteria must be spoken aloud, then the wand pulls towards the preferred object.

name: Match
occupation: WILDERNESS RECLUSE
Modernity gets between us and our natural instincts. You’re here begrudgingly after a lifetime in the wild of Deep Country.
debt: Liongoat Ice and Rescue
Take combined ownership of a torso-sized block of ice and a push-barrow for transport.
oddity_1: WHERE DID YOU GO?
The Woods: Take a bear trap (d8 if sprung).
oddity_2: WHAT HELPED YOU SURVIVE?
Your old Crossbow (d6, BULKY), stolen from bandits.

name: Debbum
occupation: RETAIL THERAPIST
You helped people spend money you had no hope of ever earning. None of it rubbed off onto you.
debt: Finbrake Re-burglary

oddity_2: WHO WAS YOUR BEST CLIENT?

name: Feau.

debt: Severin Sistern’s Underground Cruises

oddity_2: WHAT WENT WRONG?
Urban Apes Took Your Lock, but a small chimp (5HP, d6 bite) decided to go with you.

name: Firmate
occupation: INVESTMENT CENTURION

Compulsion Cube - Covered in buttons and switches. Anybody seeing it for the first time is DEPRIVED until they get to play with it or get their own.
oddity_2: HOW DID YOU KEEP TRACK OF THE NUMBERS?
You Outsourced the Difficult Stuff: You know most dialects and can imitate them pretty well.

name: Dimmock
occupation: PARK STEWARD

oddity_1: WHAT WAS THE DEAL WITH YOUR PARK?
Sank into the Underground: Take a very bright spot-lamp.
oddity_2: WHAT EQUIPMENT DID YOU BRING?
A sack of Compost (BULKY).

name: Ani.
occupation: AGRICULTURAL SABOTEUR

debt: Fantus Exotic Hatchery

Haystacks House: Take a scarecrow’s head.
oddity_2: WHAT’S THE LAST SCRAP OF YOUR LIFE AS A SABOTEUR?
One last Firebomb (d6 DAMAGE each round until extinguished).

name: Clancy
occupation: COUNTERFEIT TAXIDERMIST
Fantastic specimens bought you a small amount of money. Now that’s gone, and your name is ruined.
debt: Council for Tarts and Flans

inventory: Scissors, bag of stuffing, book of made-up beasts.
oddity_1: WHAT TYPE OF ANIMAL DO YOU KNOW EVERYTHING ABOUT?
Cephalopods: Take a stuffed claw-squid.
oddity_2: HOW DID YOU GET FOUND OUT AS A FRAUD?
Confessed after Losing a Duel: Take a sabre (d6).

name: Gilren
occupation: CRITIC-IN-HIDING
Everybody loves a scathing critique, except those under the lens. For safety, you’ve changed your name and got a new haircut.
debt: Vortex Acquisitions
Share ownership of a portal bomb (one use, anything caught in the BLAST is transported back to an empty vault atVortex HQ).
oddity_1: WHAT WAS YOUR AREA OF CRITIQUE?
Revolutions: Take a signed antique musket (d8, BULKY, breaks forever on a 7+).
oddity_2: WHAT WENT WRONG?
You were Floated out to Sea: Take a flare gun (2 Flares).

name: Bota
occupation: MASKED HORRORIST
Horrors rise from the Underground. We must make a friend of fear, and scare them back down
debt: The Populads
You can never remember the name or face of somebody in this Union, or what they really do, but you can always find a member when you need one.
oddity_1: WHAT’S YOUR MASK?
The Famine Machine: You can eat metal in place of food.
oddity_2: WHAT ABOUT WHEN YOU TAKE THE MASK OFF?
You had it surgically attached and can never take it off.

name: Ranulph
occupation: CRIMINAL BUREAUCRAT
The laws of Bastion are written so every crime has a loophole. People paid you to perform crimes, legally.
debt: The Backward Legion
They accept stolen items of modern technology for twice their value against your debt, but destroy them immediately.
oddity_1: WHAT WAS YOUR SPECIALITY?
Burglary: Take 3 smokebombs.
oddity_2: WHAT DID YOUR LAST CLIENT PAY YOU IN PLACE OF MONEY?
Echojector - Hears up to ten seconds of sound and repeats it at vastly increased volume on command.

name: Silvid.
occupation: AMATEUR DRAMATIST
The whole world is a stage. But you’re not good enough to get paid.
debt: Porkee Sheddam, Owner of Paradiso Park Bastion
Take shared ownership of a very compliant show-pig (3HP).
oddity_1: WHAT WAS YOUR SPECIALITY?
Booming Presence: Your voice carries extremely far.
oddity_2: WHAT PROP DO YOU STILL HAVE?
A barely-trained Stage Cow (3HP, d4 bite).

name: Hessamora.
occupation: CONSTABLE OF BIRDS AND CREEPING THINGS
Written by Arnold Kemp. Protector of the laws of nature.
debt: The Society of Licensed Birds

A decrepit opera hall, home to many of Bastion's registered avians. Some roost in the opera boxes, while waterbirds nest in the flooded orchestra pit. While all of the office-holders are birds, the actual governing is performed by their human secretaries. They oversee all bird law in Bastion.
inventory: Hammer (d6), net, pamphlet of local laws.
oddity_1: WHAT WAS YOUR SPECIALITY?

Bird Catcher: Bird language is too difficult to learn. Instead you gain a bird detainment jacket, capable of restraining dove-sized birds in its sleeves, and slingshotting the same birds out at will. Maximum capacity is 6 birds per sleeve. Currently holding 3 pigeons in your left sleeve (vagrancy) and a crow in your right sleeve (arson). Could theoretically be used for other objects, but the idea has never occurred to you.
oddity_2: WHAT FIELD OF LAW ARE YOU MOST EXPERIENCED IN?
Truancy: You gain a "No Loitering" sign. If hung on a wall, subtle psychic emanations cause creatures to avoid the location, instead preferring to hang out somewhere else.

name: Zastra
occupation: PRACTISING CHEMIST
A truly modern profession. And you’re almost qualified to do it.
debt: Sweep’s Union

inventory: Long knife (d6), big flask, test tube.

Metal-Eating-Acid - Has no effect on any other material.
oddity_2: WHAT’S IN THE TEST TUBE?
Cryo-Dust - Instantly freeze a bathtub-sized amount of water when poured in.

name: Morrison
occupation: CRIMINAL BUREAUCRAT

A sentient, building-sized gambling machine. Whenever you visit it offers a spin of its wheels to halve the debt, or double in the case of a loss. Odds are 52% in favour of the Engine.
oddity_1: HOW DID YOU GET YOUR START IN THE CORPSE DISPOSAL INDUSTRY?
Widow Tender: Take an expandable umbrella.
oddity_2: WHAT WAS YOUR GREAT PROJECT? (YOU COULDN’T GET FUNDING)
The Protein Reclamation Initiative: Take a jar of flavour-masking rub (makes anything palatable).

name: Chico.
occupation: FRONT OF HOUSE HOST
You were the face of a company. Now you’re a face without a company.
debt: Slugburn Pest Control
Take a very large pack of slug pellets.
oddity_1: WHO WAS YOUR EMPLOYER?
ACounterfeitJeweller:Takeafakeruby(worth£1ktosomebodyunknowing).
oddity_2: WHAT MADE YOU MEMORABLE?
You Know Anybody’s Name just by looking at them.

name: Remark
occupation: FASHIONISTA
There are none more tragic than those that lack the Modern Look. SPECIAL: You are DEPRIVED if you dress without making a statement.
debt: The Lion Council
A literal council of lions. They want interesting meat up to the value of your debt. A lioness already hunts you to seek payment.
oddity_1: AFTER MUCH DELIBERATION, WHAT IMPRACTICAL WEAPON DID YOU SETTLE ON?
Hand Scorcher (d6, super-heating metal rod, requires a turn to heat up).
oddity_2: WHAT’S THE CATCH WITH THIS OUTFIT?
It makes a Lot of Noise when you move.

name: Ugo
occupation: LOST EXPEDITIONEER
You’ve been on a treasure hunting expedition before. You were the only survivor.
debt: The Elephant Reimbursement House
Reclaimed ivory goods pay double their value against your debt.
oddity_1: WHAT WAS YOUR POSITION ON THE CREW?
Saucier: Take a set of tiny saucepans.
oddity_2: WHAT DID YOU BRING BACK FROM THE EXPEDITION?

Fetch-Pearl – When thrown into a body of water, this silvery pearl sinks to the bottom and clings to the first thing it touches. On a mental command it returns to the surface, dragging up whatever it attached to.

name: Nicol.
occupation: CRITTER CATCHER
Bastion’s gutters and pipes are home to every beast you can imagine. You always wanted to study them all.
debt: Glasshead Psychiatric Tonics
If you all agree to taking an experimental remedy you can remove £2500 from your Debt. The remedy lasts a week, during which time you are physically incapable of lying.
oddity_1: WHAT WAS YOUR SPECIALITY?
Bugs: Take a trained grasshopper (1HP) in a cage.
oddity_2: WHAT ELSE DID YOU BRING?
A stolen set of Brass Knuckles (d6).

name: Ducton.
occupation: UNDER-LABOURER
Construction work on the Underground continues. Despite its lack of regard for time and space.
debt: Camwick & Bodeyman Herbal Remedies
Each take a pack of all-purpose herbal tablets.
oddity_1: WHAT DO YOU KNOW ABOUT THE UNDERGROUND?
The Secret of Connection: If there is a quicker underground route between two points than the one you have planned, you know it.
oddity_2: WHY DON’T YOU LIKE THE SURFACE?
You’re Sensitive To Sunlight. Take some tinted goggles, and your attacks are IMPAIRED in daylight unless you wear them.

name: Mox.
occupation: EXOTIC FOOD SUPPLIER
Written by Arnold Kemp. When people tire of sundry dishes, you step in with new delicacies.
debt: Corbin Cortez the Zoo Keeper
A fearsome hunter who collected most of the animals that are displayed in his zoo. Assisted by a gorilla butler and a mocking bird.
inventory: Large bucket of the appropriate food, long-handled fork (d6).
oddity_1: WHAT IS THE EXOTIC FOOD THAT YOU PROCURED?
Pickled Eggler: Take a pickling jar. Currently full of delicious dolphin eggs. Anything you put in it becomes both edible and preserved.
oddity_2: WHO DID YOU SELL TO?
The Lords of Aluminium and Lumber: Take a powerful rotary saw (d8, BULKY, can cut metal, but slowly and loudly).

name: Bagginton.
occupation: PUBLIC NUISANCE
Something about you has always annoyed others. You can’t imagine what it is.
debt: Black Maze Security
Take shared ownership of a spark bomb (once activated, fires annoying sparks for d4 DAMAGE to everyone in the BLAST and continues to fire for ten minutes. Can be recharged).
oddity_1: WHAT EXACTLY DO YOU DO?
Busybody: Take a dagger (d6), and a pair of binoculars.
oddity_2: WHAT’S YOUR REDEEMING FEATURE?
You once Raised a Fortune for charity. You get some recognition, but other charities hound you.

name: Binson
occupation: MAP THIEF
Written by Patrick Stuart. “Obviously I fully intended to return it.”
debt: Personal Secret Salvage
Take shared ownership of a shuttup-staple (whisper a secret about somebody else into this small box. Anybody that reveals this secret to you loses d12 CHA in agonising head pain. One use only).
inventory: Universal library card, butterfly knife (d6), lock picks, white protective gloves.
oddity_1: WHAT DID THE PREVIOUS OWNERS NOT KNOW ABOUT THE MAP YOU STOLE?
It’s a map of Angelic Hierarchies. Hunted by occultists and fools.
oddity_2: HOW DEEP IN THE MUCK DID THE STEAL GET YOU?
You just realised you Signed Your Name in the visitors’ book. Damn your thoroughness!

name: Dewie
occupation: RURALTAX COLLECTOR
You’ve spent more time than you care on the roads of Deep Country. Squinting at obsolete currencies was your life.
debt: Bastiard Free Press Council
You have a shared subscription to a local newspaper, delivered daily to a personal box nearby.
oddity_1: WHAT DID THE TAX OFFICE PROVIDE YOU WITH?
A Mock Ferret (1HP, knows two songs).
oddity_2: WHAT DO YOU HATE MOST ABOUT BASTION?
Modern Clothes: You are DEPRIVED if you are fashionably dressed.

name: Ogtred
occupation: PARK STEWARD
Bastion’s parks have grown out of hand. Yours was one of the worst.
debt: Fallendine’s Mechanical Heart Company
You all have at least partly mechanical hearts. If a strong magnet is placed near your chest you must pass a STR SAVE or die.
oddity_1: WHAT WAS THE DEAL WITH YOUR PARK?
Caught Fire and Never Stopped: Take a fire extinguisher (foam).
oddity_2: WHAT EQUIPMENT DID YOU BRING?
A Bee Can (compressed bee-hive in a can, produces a small amount of honey or can be broken to release an angry swarm).

name: Lars.
occupation: DEAD-SHORESMAN
You died, but found a way back from where you went. Nobody believes you, and everyone you once knew is long gone.
debt: King Haffwun of Shambly Hole
You are all branded as property of this Deep Country King.
inventory: Flintpistol (d8, outdated and hard to repair), broken oar (d6), cold blood.
oddity_1: £1 Family Name: A powerful name in Bastion.
Streets of Bastion: You know your way around the entire city perfectly.
oddity_2: 1HP Amnesia Flask - Anybody doused in the water loses a specific memory as defined by the douser. Anybody drinking the water as it falls absorbs the memories. Refills require a Specialist source.
Second-Chance Skull - If you die, your body disintegrates to ash and immediately regenerates from this skull in perfect health.

name: Baztum
occupation: DIVINE PRODIGY
Raised in a cult retreat for a single purpose, which didn’t work out. Now cast out into the world.
debt: Walken Civic Gorilla Studies

You have a Civic Gorilla chaperone (5HP, d8 maul). It is highly civilised and obedient, but never violent and still bound by the limits of being a gorilla. If it returns to your Debtholder having learned something about the world your Debt is halved. If it is lost, your Debt is doubled.
oddity_1: WHAT WAS YOUR PURPOSE?
To Birth/Sire the Voidchild: You have a chastity belt welded on.
oddity_2: WHAT WENT WRONG?
You Lost a Cult War: Lose an arm.

name: Ante
occupation: REPURPOSED AUGMENTAL
Mechanically adapted for a purpose you were unable to fulfil. You found a job somewhere else.
debt: Drumm Personal Security
Weapons pay off this debt at twice their normal value.
oddity_1: WHAT WAS YOUR JOB?
Electricity Station Labour: Take a set of rubberised tongs.
oddity_2: HOW ARE YOU AUGMENTED?
Remodelled Internals: You do not need to eat or breathe.

name: Helmut
occupation: SANCTIONED EXECUTIONER
You’ve done your time on firing squads. Now you’re allowed to do a little freelance work.
debt: The Psycho-Pack
You are all mind-tethered together. If you focus really hard you can project one word per minute to your pack.
inventory: Rifle (d8, BULKY), killing licence (one person per day, non-transferable).
oddity_1: HOW DO YOU LIVE WITH YOURSELF?
Philanthropy: Charitable organisations know you as a generous donor.
oddity_2: WHAT WAS YOUR BONUS FOR GOOD SERVICE?

Smart Arm - Your rifle is also intelligent, communicating psychically to whoever is holding it. It functions as a normal weapon and gives smart advice. Once per day it grants +d10 to an attack that particularly pleases it, but it can IMPAIR attacks that displease it any time it likes. Roll 1d6 to find its personality: 1: Honourable, 2: Ambitious, 3: Bloodthirsty, 4: Curious, 5: Pacifist, 6: Bored.

name: Yerlott
occupation: CRYPTOHISTORIAN
Concept by Zachary Cox. Student of a history that never was. Expert in the present that cannot be.
debt: The Hot Slab, Morgue and Social Club
Take shared ownership of a case of 12 bottles of Highly Carbonated Formaldehyde. It can be drunk without harm for a mild buzz, but causes foul-smelling trapped wind.
inventory: Thin Dagger (d6), Absolute Chronometer (a pocket watch that always keeps its time, even in the presence of time- altering phenomena).
oddity_1: WHICH ALTERNATIVE HISTORY DID YOU STUDY?
The Shadow Before: Take a set of chalk. If you draw around somebody’s shadow you can sleep within that outline to have dreams that show their memories.
oddity_2: HOW ARE YOU MESSED UP BY EXPERIMENTING WITH TIME?
You have a Helpful Time-Clone in Bastion: You’re on good terms, and help each other out from time to time.

name: Augoner
occupation: GRIEF DIPLOMAT
A life of carrying bad messages and managing expectations. You appreciated their patience.
debt: Alligator Yul
A crime lord with a terrible alligator gimmick. If anybody laughs at him he adds £500 to their Debt.
oddity_1: WHAT WAS YOUR SPECIALITY?
Comforting Survivors: Take a council joke book.
oddity_2: WHAT WENT WRONG?
You were Used as a Scapegoat for a gross scandal. The public hate you, but you’ve earned some favours in the Borough Council.

name: Machel
occupation: INVESTMENT CENTURION
Concept by Matt "Catapult" Wang. Leader of a hundred traders. Any one of them would have sold you out.
debt: The People’s Paperworks
If they find out you have bought any printed-goods that weren’t printed by them they add £500 to your Debt.
oddity_1: WHAT DID YOU MANAGE TO RECLAIM FROM YOUR DESK?
Stress Hammer - Immensely satisfying hammer (d6) that restores any CHA loss if you use it to break something worth at least £1k or wound somebody with it.
oddity_2: HOW DID YOU KEEP TRACK OF THE NUMBERS?
The Modern Way: Take a multi-function electric calculator. Requires significant winding up before use.

name: Gourd
occupation: URBAN SAFARIST
The human condition makes for fascinating viewing. At least for those too rich to have worries.
debt: Baroness Joleen Mast of Rosevine
Rules from a distant Failed City, but has relatives in Bastion. Insists on payment in person.
oddity_1: WHAT KEEPS YOU SAFE?
A Startle-Gun (fires loud but blank shots).
oddity_2: WHAT GETS YOU INTO HIDDEN PLACES?
You were Raised in the Underground and have weird family down there, but you look remarkably normal.

name: Aben/abid
occupation: INSEPARABLE TWINS
